Review_body: Staring Mel Gibson, Danny glover how can it be bad! There's never a moment that I'm bored rewatching this film. I'm either entranced in the great action or smiling at the heartwarming moments of the two cops. It's got to be near my top 3 favorite movies ever.

Review title: Love all 4 of these movies like I love the first 3 Die Hards and that's saying a lot
Review_body: Gibson and Glover just work so well together and make the best buddy duo that you can't stop watching and Joe Pesci adds a good amount of comedic relief, the way he's picked on and the things he does and says.

Review title: The Best of the Lethal Weapon Series
Review_body: Lethal Weapon is typical of the tough hard-nosed action films of the 80's and is a great piece of escapist mayhem.The story, penned by action specialist Shane Black, involves suicidal cop Riggs (Mel Gibson) teaming up with by-the-books family cop Murtaugh (Danny Glover) to combat a nasty drug syndicate headed by baddies Gary Busey and Mitch Ryan.Although the premise is nothing overly original, it provides a great springboard for what makes this film really work -- the  interplay between the two vastly different lead characters and the top-notch excitement-filled action pieces.Gibson and Glover work very well together, and unlike the other Lethal Weapons where the humour comes from specially scripted jokes or characters (eg. Joe Pesci), this Lethal derives its humour from the situations these two cops keep getting stuck in. For instance, Riggs as the suicidal cop (resulting from the recent death of his wife) has no fear and just walks head first into dangerous situations. It's a real laugh to see him doing his job because you just don't know what he's going to do next. The drug deal at the start where he plays three-stooges with the dealers and gives them 100 bucks for their stash is a fine example and is bound to raise more than a few smiles. Later he teams up with good cop Murtaugh and more mayhem ensues as these two adjust to each other's methods of policing. But in the spirit of all these types of movies, they end up being the best of pals and team up to really make the villains pay.The villains here are the best out of all the Lethal Weapons, with the exception of Jet Li in no. 4. Gary Busey gives one of his best performances as ex-mercenary "Mr Joshua" who now finds drug dealing a profitable pastime. The final fight between Joshua and Riggs is a highlight and apparently took 4 days to shoot. However, there are many other adrenalin-charged sequences between cops and scumbags including an explosive bus crash and a chase down Hollywood boulevard with the bare chested, machine gun packing Riggs going all-out to do his job.In summary, this is a great combination of action and comedy which is not seen in the more politically-correct action films of the 90's. Clearly the pick of the Lethal Weapon series and one of the best cop films of the 80's!8.5 - 9 / 10

Review title: The quintessential buddy cop action flick!
Review_body: Lethal Weapon is the eighties action film that kicked off the whole buddy-cop trope in Hollywood. It's directed by Richard Donner (Superman II) and penned by Shane Black (Predator). Our cast of stars features Danny Glover and Mel Gibson in the lead roles with Gary Busey as a henchman to the main villain, The General played by Mitchell Ryan. I decided to pair the film with a nice Indica like King Louis XIII from Marley Natural. It's a relaxing strain that provides a good deal of happiness. A good combination to dive right into a badass picture like this. The earthy tastes and piny aromas pair well with a good beer too. If that's your kind of thing. The film follows the pairing of two LAPD detectives. Martin Riggs is a detective that is psychologically broken and emotionally damaged following the death of his wife. Roger Murtaugh is a veteran cop that works hard to support his family. They get paired together as partners working various crimes and bonding. Roger is constantly tested by Riggs' inherently psychotic behavior. He almost gives up. However, after things go south and the duo bands together to put an end to a very dangerous group of drug smugglers called Shadow Company. The film features cheesy action film acting and witty dialogue, mostly between Gibson and just about everyone he comes in contact with. His Martin Riggs character is iconic. He stands as one of the best cops in movie history. Danny Glover is the perfect straight man but it's kind of unfortunate that he was so tight cast. Busey is badass in this movie. He looks awesome and does a great job of projecting himself as menacing. Tom Atkins is good too, his role is minimal, but he gives it everything. That is up until his death, which is rather goofy looking. Lethal Weapon also has an amazing soundtrack provided by Michael Kamen and Eric Clapton. Yes, that Eric Clapton. The howling saxophone and blazing guitar set upon a sprawling Los Angeles cityscape provide an amazing atmosphere for the story. The soundtrack provides a great technique for building suspense that gets paid off with intense action scenes. This movie is a hell of a ride. It builds an amazing world that gets explored at break-neck speed. In some cases it's far too fast-paced to be bad. All of the faults with the film are steamrolled by the constant action. The fight scenes are brutal and unrelenting. The final showdown is a thing of pure eighties glory. I love it. It's a classic that should be enjoyed by everyone at least once! There's a reason that It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia loves it so much. The King Louis XIII paired really well with Lethal Weapon. It tasted so good, I ended up having an extra snapper or two. The cannabis had me feeling really relaxed and sunken into my couch. The uplifting effects had me alert and ready for the suspense of the action scenes, which were numerous. The effects were long lasting and are still prevalent when writing this review. Although it feels great, the taste and smell are the leading factors with this particular batch from Marley Natural. Check it out if you can!

Review title: Best American Action film ever made
Review_body: OK, Might sound crazy but this is my favorite film of all time.  This is the classic buddy movie.  It contains all the elements of a great film.  Drama, action, comedy, and suspense.  While I realize that it can't be categorized as a classic.  I have more fun watching this movie than any other film ever made.  And isn't that the point of a movie!

Review title: Richard Donner has created a great buddy cop film that shall serve as a blueprint for all films in this subgenre.
Review_body: Lethal Weapon is a fun, exciting movie that deserves its standing in the pantheon of great action films. Contrary to popular believe this film didn't make Mel Gibson a star- He already was one after Mad Max but it did make him a household name in the US. He and Danny Glover are amazing as the mismatched buddy cop duo and one can say Lethal Weapon restarted the sub genre after 48 hours had done so a few years ago. Featuring great sequences, dialogues worth remembering and great pace Lethal Weapon is a must watch.

Review title: A solid action film with believable forces of the law.
Review_body: I honestly found this film while in need of a classic action film to want. Most action films today are contaminated with CGI and green screen - not to say these always make a film bad - and I needed to wind down with a film that relied more on strict and up close attention, rather than persistent back-at-the-studio editing and milked dry standstills.My positive attention was quickly brought over to the photography of this film, at least when it started up and playing. The most noticeable shots in this film are the wide-shots, which I complimented consistently for the beautiful shots of California and the plentiful buildings that stretch onwards. I - most notably - favoured the shots that captured the diversity of California, if anything, seeing as most films I've watched care more about focusing on the same wide-shot that is supposed to, at first, open the film; same day, time, setting - boring.The music was also diverse, much like the photography. Depending on a character's mood, an escalating situation, a rising trouble, the music and the instruments used to create said music moved forward with the deed of switching up their sounds. Instead of leaving us with the same strict genre of music, no matter the situation, Lethal Weapon would be sure to find the perfect sound to help its audience stay attentive to the situation taking place on their digital screens. The placements of music are what kept me focused on the intensifying actions scenes.The actors, even the ones likely being paid the least, were very exceptional throughout the duration of the film. Plenty of films forget to give even the minor characters a decent piece of dialogue - a common mistake that even I have made, so there's not necessarily serious harm. Throughout Lethal Weapon, I happened to find myself pleased over how every character had something to say in reference to the main characters and the crimes that had taken place and only continued to take place. This helped be seek more belief that I was watching a crime related film.The main characters belonged rightfully to both Danny Glover and Mel Gibson. Danny's performance triumphed multiple emotions successfully; Roger didn't want to feel old, which could be evident through the visible fear on his face. He boxed in a strong sense of justice, which could be evident in his more serious expression whenever Riggs performed a disagreeable act. Mel Gibson's inner craziness brought Riggs to life with his many expressions drifting from serious and psychopathic.The characters felt realistic, another success this film upholds. From the kids (despite bad acting), to the general family, to Riggs, to the police department, the way they all spoke and interacted with their environments were done in a way that made me forget I was watching a film at all. These traits aren't hard to miss, and I can assure you that you will have fun seeking these little hints during your watch.The villains were average to me. The actors did a great job at filling out their villainy, but I felt that the overworked use of bringing in helicopters, excessive amount of rifles and ridiculous accuracy when holding firearms weakened the form of action I was looking for. The film has its positive moments when it comes to the shootouts, but the scenes that burden the film are the ones that are too energetic when it comes to the mistake of provoking the word 'action' too far.I was informed that the comedy in this film was good, but I'd have to differ from that belief. Very few scenes got me smile, never mind laugh. I got a whiff at the lack of good comedy when I noticed that the genres for the film never contained comedy, even though the jokes are whacked there and there. If you've arrived to this film hoping for an action and comedy duo similar to that of 'Rush Hour', you're not going to find it here and would find more prosperity looking somewhere else.

This film is truly the greatest action film of all time, with only Die Hard and the other 'Lethal' sequels coming close. In these days of XXX and Bad Boys II, and The Island, thank god that action fans still can watch the real action movies, the kind that Hollywood simply doesn't make any more. Mel Gibson and Danny Glover make the perfect on-screen partnership, in my opinion it is the best ever seen. Throughour the 4 movies, their chemistry never fails. The direction is superb from Richard Donner and the screenplay by Shane Black is remarkable as it was his first movie script. Why this film has such a low rating is beyond me, it deserves and 8.5 at the very least. Any one who likes action films but hasn't seen this should do so because every action flick that you've enjoyed is thanks to the standard set by this 1987 CLASSIC.

Review title: the way action movies should be made again!
Review_body: God, I miss these type of action movies... Two good Vietnam veteran cops cleaning up the streets of LA from drug dealing Vietnam vets and mercenaries. This movie was and still is one of the best action movies ever made. The chemistry between Danny Glover and Mel Gibson as Roger Murtaugh and Martin Riggs was the original (and still the best) template for many other buddy cop flicks to follow. I give major credit and would like to thank Richard Donner, Shane Black and Joel Silver for making this movie work on every level. I hope that one day these types of movies will return to the big screen again. I can only hope, since movies have become very unoriginal.

Review title: A perfect blend of humor and action. Strongly recommended.(Spoilers)
Review_body: I watched Lethal Weapon in the theater when it first came out in 1987, it blew me away. I've never seen such a movie like that before, it had been copied for numerous times so it wouldn't be so appealing nowadays. I bought DVDs of the Lethal Weapon series. To me, this one still stands out as the best of the four. Its brilliance and luster retains even though I watch it in 2008. It certainly deserves to get at least one Oscar for the performance and some special effects but it was overlooked. One of the most eloquent evidence that proves the Academy Award is a joke.First, this movie starts with a aerial view of the city of Los Angeles. As the title "Lethal Weapon" appears, you get a feeling this is not only a cop movie but also an ultimate blockbuster. Later, the camera stops in the balcony. We see a half-naked woman lying on the bed, as if she is drowned or her high is coming up. However, she somehow climbs onto the balcony and takes a dive out of the building. Her death leads to an introduction of an middle-aged cop who is celebrating his birthday. His name is Murtaugh(played by Danny Glover), he is fifty years old when he takes this case. Later, he is informed he will be partnered with a cop named Riggs(played by Mel Gibson), only to find out the cop is suicidal because his wife was killed in a car accident a few years ago. First, the two cops detest each other very much. As time goes on, they become accustomed to each other and they stand together to fight against the bad guys of the movie. The bad guys are a bunch of veterans who become drug dealers by smuggling the heroin from Vietnam. Their leader is stern general and a macho guy named Joshua(played by Gary Busey), who is the top guy in the unit. All the actors were doing a great job and delivered believable, flesh-and-blood, and comical characters. Mel Gibson gave an outstanding performance as Riggs. His hardened exterior could not cover up the fragile interior of his. He was in a dilemma whether to kill himself or go on living. Danny Glover was also remarkable, he did everything "by the book", who could ever forget his characteristics: Shooting criminals in the leg and shooting people directly in the head. Gary Busey gave his best performance to date. This is one movie he ever immersed into his character. The action scenes were perfectly done. Almost two hours of non-stop action can satisfy action fans. Also, it can be considered a comedy to watch when you want to get rid of your burden. Also, some people have the tradition to watch it on Christmas. It can have different significance and interpretation reviewed by different people. Good story, good actors, crazy action, comical scenes, and significant masterpiece. This movie is a landmark of cop movies. 20 years and it still retains all these good elements. Strongly recommended for you to watch it.

This Thrill-packed action-drama is second only to Die Hard In the best action movies of all time. Mel Gibson's charecter is however the best in the long magnificent history of action movie  charecters. 10/10  See it as soon as you can, Even if you've seen it before. Yes It's just that good.

There is a lot of cop movies out in the world, like Die Hard, Beverly Hills cop, Bad Boys and then it is the Lethal Weapon series. Honestly i think that Lethal Weapon is one of the best cop movies ever made and shares the top with Die Hard.All Lethal Weapon movies are good but the first one is the best, no doubt. Martin Riggs(Mel Gibson) is a suicidal cop who never hesitate too throw himself into danger. Roger Murtaugh(Danny Glover)is worried getting old, he recently celebrated this 50th birthday and gets contacted by Micheal Hunsaker an old friend, Murtaugh haven't seen him for 12 years. When Murtaugh is called to investigate a suicide, he his horrified when he discovers that the victim is Hunsaker's daughter Amanda. Martin Riggs and Roger Murtaugh becomes against there will, partners. And together they need to find out who is behind the Amanda case, and Leeds them to a gang of international drug smugglers.Richard Donner does a great job with his directing, but the biggest stars goes to Mel Gibson and Danny Glovers almost perfectly performance, also the rest of the cast makes a good performance like Gary Busey and Tom Atkins.Lethal Weapons is not one of the best movie i have ever seen, but it is with no doubt on of the best action flicks i have ever seen, the movie is very exciting and good looking and if you haven't seen this, go see it...

It'll thrill you from the opening scene to the last minute an actioner and a great buddy movie.The best of the series and a classic.Martin Riggs is a recently widowed presumed pshycopathic cop.He is on the edge after a prostitute presumably commits suicide he is called in on the case.His partner is Roger Murrtagh a family man with a lot of money and three wreck less kids.The two at first don't like each other but gradually their relationship grows.The two get caught up in the murder. Which turns out to be involved with Heroin dealing and prostitution.Thrills and spills a plenty with an evil villain.

Review title: A MUST SEE FOR ALL AGES
Review_body: Simply put, this is the film that made me a fan of Mel Gibson and Gary Busey. Even now if I see it on cable, I stop and watch a few scenes. Cool action with clever dialouge makes Lethal Weapon a timeless classic.

A must see for action fans worldwide!  Outstanding plot, and there is a special magic between Danny Glover and Mel Gibson.  Lots of cliche's and twists!  I would HIGHLY recommend it for everyone!  It has "tear jerker" qualities, a little too much violence, but all in all I would rate it among the top 10 I've ever seen.

Review title: The best buddy cop movie of the 80s
Review_body: I love this movie !! Mel Gibson as a psycho pinching suicidal cop and Danny Glover as a family man cop and they are both a great chemistry with each other and that spawned 3 more sequels and they were all great. You can't have a better buddy cop movie than this . Gary Busey playing Joshua was awesome in this playing very vicious in this and Mitchell Ryan did a great job as General Mccalister. It's a typical 80s movie with that hairstyle mullet that Mel was wearing which was very iconic. If you new millennials didn't see it yet , then check it out and the three other sequels after it and you will love it!!

This movie the first time I watched it had me falling off the couch laughing. From the amazing action elements to the comedy, this has to be the best action movie of all time. Mel Gibson plays a suicidal cop and Vietnam veteran who basically has a death wish and he is partnered with cop who has a family who is Danny Glover. These two who at first can't stand each other, eventually have a bond and together they are unstoppable against the dug traffickers who have been bribing I heroin from Vietnam since the Vietnam War.If you want a good action movie with a little bit of comedy in it then this is your movie. This movie redefined the buddy cop action genre. Once you have watched this movie, you have to see the rest because they are all great action movies. Overall, Lethal Weapon is one of my favourite films and arguably the best action flick of all time!

Review title: Watched Lethal Weapon With My Eldest Daughter
Review_body: The slightly extended directors cut.What a MASTERPIECE!!My 11 yr old was transfixed by the rampant badassery on screen. Mr Joshua was her favourite character. This confirms for me that Zoe will go far in life ha ha ha ha haAwesome film. I won't do a review, because we have all seen it a million times, but this film is flawless. I now rate it above Die Hard, whereas before tonight Die Hard was higher on the ratings scale. The action is so believable and the characters have so much depth. Plus of course, the acting and directing and writing is sublime. The film also has immense heart. Fact.Riggs contemplating killing himself with the gun = Gibson acting genius11/10the schoolyard scene should never have been left out of the original film. Having Riggs kick off his law enforcement with the Xmas tree drug dealers did not show you the depths of his psychosis, depression and the power of his death wish. Though it is touched upon later with the trailer-gun-in-mouth-near-suicide scene, the school-yard REALLY drums it home! It sets a completely darker tone for the first two acts. You realise the guy just doesn't give a toss and will do the job as hard as fast he can do play it until he receives the welcome relief of death.A badass and awesome scene. Loved it! What a movie Gibson = GOD!!

Review title: The Best Buddy Cop movie of all time!
Review_body: Mel Gibson and Danny Glover are perfect as a team.Murtaugh, a middle-age family man that thinks he's getting too old for his job. His life is pretty much ordinary until he gets a new partner.Riggs, a psychotic cop that's dangerous and likes to do things his own way and is always on the edge of things. He considers suicide everyday because of the loss of the woman he loved, but somehow he sees the bright side of life.These two guys don't get along very well at first and are completely the opposite of one another, but when the bad guys kidnap Murtaughs daughter, Riggs and Murtaugh will go all the way to get her back.This outstanding movie provides explosions, car chases, lots of action, great fight scenes, hilarious humor and plenty more that will keep us in a good mood.Enjoy!Rating: 8/10

Review title: Lethal Weapon, The most iconicle police movie of the 80's.
Review_body: Now to start with, i am not going to write a long boring review about how good the acting is or stuff like that. I am just going to make a short strong review of how great and iconicle this movie is.This movie, unlike 'Die Hard' has a real solid background-story. It's not some random tough-ass cop who breaks the law to make sure other's respect it. This is different. There's story of a cop who has lost an important person in his life and who has suicidal tendencies. The whole story is so well directed that the movie itself is a masterpiece. Not only because most 80's action movies are cheesy and have tons of unrealistic actionscenes. But because the humour, the sincerity and the action are all well balanced into a slightly touchy buddy-cop movie. An all-time well respected classic in its kind.
Really great film to watch. Action packed with likable characters.

Review title: It's aged. It's fun. It worth a watch.
Review_body: This is a fun good cop, bad cop movie that hasn't aged too well. The characters are pretty fun and likable, and you can clearly see their motivations well. I really like Riggs' depression and suicide motif, and how that affects him in the first part of the movie. The villain was pretty fun too, although their history is a little weird and shaky with the Vietnam connection. The reason it's a little dated is just because of the situations they get themselves into. The dry lake action scenes feels very one-sides: it was two dudes against 20 and a helicopter, and the two dudes held their own. The torture scene was pretty okay as far as Riggs goes (with the electrical shock) but Murtagh was literally just have salt rubbed into wounds. Don't get me wrong, that's hurts, but compared to modern day torture scenes in movies it just seems comical. Finally, the last scene where a Riggs (a cop) bare knuckle fights the villain while 40 cops watch and Murtagh yells at them to stay back just feels... wrong? Silly? Completely out of character for a police department? It's good to show that Riggs has changed (because he didn't kill the dude, at first at least) but it just feels like that isn't at all what any sort of law enforcement would do. The suspension of disbelief in this wasn't needed in any enough in any other scenes, but was really needed in these. I will day though, the camera work is 👌🏻. It feels alive. The camera always seems to be moving, which is really cool. Furthermore, the focus on the DOF on some shots was sooo shallow, and even the ones in motion was crystal sharp. Really good shot selection. It was still fun, but it just felt a little dated.

Review title: Have you ever met anybody you didn't kill?!
Review_body: This movie was one of the most awesome I have ever seen. The special effects, prime. A great cast, too. Mel Gibson plays, on the edge of insanity cop, Martin Riggs. Along with Danny Glover, the all too safe and sane, Roger Murtaugh. Banned together as partners against their will. Together they find them selves neck deep in ex-special forces mercenaries, drugs, and murder. It all starts when Amanda Hunsaker takes a leap off a 8th story balcony. They trace her to hooker Dixie, who leads them to the corrupt General Peter McAllister, and the Heartless mercenary called Mr.Joshua. Together they must brave all when Murtaugh's daughter Rianne is kidnapped. This movie is so great, I absolutely love it. I would definitely suggest picking up a copy. Another movie I would suggest is Mad Max.Favorite 'rewind' scenes: Where Riggs contemplates suicide, and When he jumps off the building into the balloon/air bag.

I love these movies! I have all four of them now. I was just recently introduced to the series by my uncle, even though I'm sure I'd seen one or two of the movies before, just never paid that much attention or thought they wouldn't be great movies because #1 was made when I was two years old, #2 when I was made when I was four, #3 when I was seven...#4 wasn't that bad because it was made in '98, when I was 13 ...haha. But anyway, I love them and I'm actually watching #2 right now! I love Joe Pesci..hehe.~Heather~--Let he among us without sin be the first to condemn." --RENT

I've seen all the 'Lethal Weapon' movies, and the original is still the best. While the others are great movies on their own, they seem to take too much of a comedic edge; I enjoyed this movie the most due to its action-packed sequences and mature theme. It definitely is a 'lethal' movie!

Every so often a movie comes out that redefines the way movies are watched. Lethal Weapon is one such movie.  I still remember the sense of awe that I felt after the movie was over when I first saw it when it was first released.  Lethal Weapon is a movie filled with action and laughs that entertains.

Review title: Looking back, this was a DUMB movie
Review_body: OK, I'll admit that when I saw this movie upon its release, I thought it was the most awesome cop movie I had ever seen. It's only upon looking back with the benefit of 21 years of experience that I can say it truly is a dumb movie, one that doesn't hold up to scrutiny. A total departure from "real life".I don't know why they bother to make these brainless movies. Are they made just to placate the dumb crowd, who wouldn't know real police activity if it jumped up and arrested them? This series got stupider and stupider as it went along -- more insulting to the viewer's intelligence in each installment. Eventually they became a political vehicle for a gun control message. Showing the public the evils of "cop-killer bullets" -- you know, the handgun-caliber ammunition that can punch right through the blade of a front-end loader. *groan* Yeah, right.I'll never watch one of these movies again. They're for idiots.

Review title: Tell my young self,this movie isn't that great
Review_body:
I'm sorry to say, I'm a child of the 80's & I just rewatched this with my younger brother, cause he's never seen any of the series, but he loves 80's movies of all styles. This movie doesn't hold up to the test of time, I'm now remembering why I never rewatched this 1 much, cause it kinda sucks. I know it's this super huge Hollywood hit from the 80's but no..it's okay, it's barely average..this doesn't hold a candle to die hard! This is the biggest 80's action franchise in which the sequels were way better! The characters in the sequels help, intro Joe Pesci & Rene Russo rejuvenated this series. Gary Busey is boring in this, so dull & barely has lines. The whole plot is convoluted & makes no sense, oh so this guy happens to be an ex military guy,his daughter, another ex military crazy now you're partner, is suicidal, sent to talk another suicidal out of suicide? Wtf? Kinda funny but, okay whatever.. ridiculous over the top plot, way out 9f left field..barely any action until the last 1/4. The Christmas vibe makes no sense, unless they were trying to copy Die Hard, idfk.
Some really scenes & dialogue is terrible..Go Spit! Yea go spit!? Huh!? Wtf? Let's have a Coke deal in broad daylight in a tree lot too..okay sure..bad guy #1 says...never..idk..all I can say is if you're young & didn't see this in the 80's don't give up on the whole series after this they get better..

Review title: Maybe the first movie I have ever watched.
Review_body: One of my favourite movies and probably the first movie I have ever watched, brought by my father on a video cassette from overseas. I think I was 4 years old when I first saw it. It is a movie full of classic action scenes, fun lines and good special effects. It is definitely a classic. This movie brings me fond memories and it makes me remember my parents as they were when I first saw the movie: young and full of energy.

The Lethal Weapon films are for any film fan, however, i aim all four films of lethal weapon to any action,comedy,thriller with romance on the side fans. I recommend you see the first lethal weapon and then 2,3 and 4. The relationships between the characters and promotion of there jobs as cops develops as the films go on, so don't be put off by the first one. P.S, i say anyone interested on wondering what its like to have a partner within the police force would love this film. I would say even though the stories may be 'good cops vs the bad guys' the lethal weapon films really make it more than just that. The films go deep into there personal lifes as well.

Review title: Not your average fast-paced, quick-witted cop thriller. Lethal Weapon has brains and a heart.
Review_body: This is one of the best cop thrillers ever made. Has to be. The sequels weren't up to much, but the number of copy-cat clones that Lethal Weapon has spawned are a tribute to its greatness. It isn't up there with Bullit and the like, but it has a great deal to offer. We all know the classic cop double-act - mistrust turns to reliance and friendship with a whole shedload of fast-quipping, gun-toting action along the way. But this film is difference. It has a very, very hard edge to it. The two leads, Gibson and Glover, are both exceptional, lifting this film above others of its ilk. The dynamic between them is...well, it makes this film a classic.In the sequels, Gibson's character lost his hard, living-on-the-fringe-of-sanity edge, which is a shame because in this first film, he really is crazy. His performance is, there's no denying it, moving, which is rare in a film like this.Anyone who hasn't seen this film should. A cop action thriller it may be, but this is unlike many (or, perhaps, any) you have seen before. And, of course, it's damn good fun!O.M. 21-5-01.

Mel Gibson and Danny Glover are very good actors especially when they do these characters. My two favorite's characters of Mel Gibson are Martin Riggs in Lethal weapon and Max in mad max. My two favorite's Danny Glover characters are Roger Murtaugh in lethal weapon and David tapp in saw. There were a lot of guns in this film and all the sequels which i thought made that very good. It was also i found quite funny but most the funny stuff was from Mel Gibson and i find hes quite a good comic actor. Danny Glover is also quite a good comic actor.

Review title: one of the best movies i've ever seen
Review_body: gibson is one of the best actors there is. if you haven't seen this you should. also watch lethal weapon 2,3,4. the movies have just the right mix of humor and drama. mel gibson is the best actor and so is danny glover, all the actors in this movie do their jobs well. but gibson stands out. bottom line. if you haven't seen this, do so.

classic case, of two cops who are forced to work together and hate each other but tend to make a good match. Lots of action, a very good plot with some good twists but the interaction between the main characters was the best thing and turned out to be very funny. Even though it doesn't lose its seriousness that way, it reminds of the classic buddy cop series/movies of that era. For example starsky and hutch, tango and cash and so on. Generally a very good and enjoyable movie which keeps you interested and haves some cheesiness from the 80s. Mel Gibson is awesome as well, at first he did gave the impression of the main star but, Danny Glover, a new face to me, proved to be an interesting character and of almost equal importance to Mel Gibson, though the story is mainly built around his environment at start. I highly recommend it to anyone who likes cop movies filled with some good amount of high quality action.

Do things like magic really exist? Well, if you've seen Lethal Weapon - not only the greatest action comedy, but perhaps also the greatest movie of all time! - you should know that the answer to that question is YES. If you don't, it's very obvious that you need to see a doctor. And in case you for some incomprehensible reason haven't seen Lethal yet, I have only one thing to say: stop reading this comment and go rent it immediately!!! There's simply no logical excuse for anyone old enough NOT to see this brilliant movie.The Lethal Weapon series started out with this film back in 1987, starring the phenomenal Mel Gibson as psychotic loose cannon Martin Riggs and Danny Glover (truly wonderful as well) as his total opposite for a partner - family man and by-the-book police officer Roger Murtaugh.Murtaugh lives a happy life with his loving family in a friendly neighborhood and is planning to retire from the force. But on his 50th birthday his life takes off in a different direction when the daughter of an old friend from Vietnam jumps out from a window and dies. This incident tosses Murtaugh into a dangerous and twisted investigation. And as if that's not enough: he is also teamed up with a new partner - a burned-out lunatic named Martin Riggs, who's been leaning on the edge of suicide ever since his wife was killed in a car crash. Roger is shocked when he meets this "lethal weapon". These two cops only have two things in common: they're both Vietnam vets and they both hate working with partners.This is my all time favorite movie, because it gives you everything you could ever ask from a great flick: action, drama, suspense, and even love (without getting all sentimental). And if you love Mel Gibson (God, he used to be so beautiful!!)- like me - this is were he makes one of his strongest and most remarkable performances. Actually, I can hardly call it acting - he IS Riggs. The emotions he's going through is so evident in his eyes and so real and cuts right through your soul: you can actually feel his pain and his anger. And Mel also contributes a great deal to the humorous element of the film with his attitude, witty comments and eagerness of doing his job: "Man, I love this job! Can we put the sirens on?" Danny Glover is outstanding as Murtaugh and serves the audience a normal, middle-aged man who is fighting with his age, a daughter who's turning into a young woman and a partner who doesn't care whether he lives or dies. Danny's hilarious making those faces and throwing back at Mel! He plays his part with great sensitivity and I think he, just like Mel, gives so much life to his character that no other actor could have done it better. And together, he and Mel undoubtedly makes the best film team there was, is or ever will be! (The concept has been copied too many times, though..." With the fantastic action, humor, performances and screenplay, Lethal Weapon and its sequels definitely top the list of all time action movies. Danny and Mel (naturally) won an award for "best duo on screen" on MTV Movie Awards once, and considering their work with these series, I believe director Richard Donner and producer Joel Silver makes the best duo OFF screen.I'm convinced this is a movie that not only action fans would enjoy watching, so I recommend it to everyone. This is a movie you can't afford to miss!

best of the four films,i especially like the beginning of the movie for it being very dark with Riggs totally maniac,totally depressing,and i think that it even got better when they brought out the collectors edition on DVD with more scenes,most of them showing Riggs in the lowest conditions. I think its a movie that also worked because of the perfect combination(Mel Gibson,Danny Glover)they both did great acting and proved a great partnership. i still think that Richard Donner could still do another lethal weapon movie in the style of this first one and have Riggs covered in xxxx again,i don't know maybe his wife could die again..........

Great action by Gibson and Glover along with Busey. Great acting by Gibson and a tremendous plot. It's interesting to see how one of my favorite actors(Mel Gibson) and one of my non-favorite actors(Danny Glover) team up in a cop movie and do a great job at it. Gary Busey plays Mr. Joshua, a mean an arrogant man who fights Gibson and Glover till it comes down to them killing Busey. Gary Busey does a great job at being a bad guy(Almost like Kevin Costner in 3000 Miles To Graceland). Overall, this movie shows how it is to be a cop and fighting the bad guys. This was one of the best cop/action movies I have ever seen. I rate this movie a an ********1/2 stars out of 10 stars.

Review title: I prefer Lethal Weapon to Die Hard!
Review_body: The first time I watched Lethal Weapon, I liked it without thinking to much of it but after watching the sequels, I really wanted to see the first again. It is now possibly my favorite action movie. Martin Riggs (Mel Gibson) is a suicidal recluse and loose canon after the death of his wife while Roger Murtaugh (Danny Glover) is a family man who just celebrated his 50th birthday and is a character most can relate to. They eventually get partnered up, neither of them wanting to work with the other as Riggs (Gibson) makes it clear that no one wants to work with him as some think he's faking the suicidal thing to draw a psycho pension and others believe he really is suicidal. They get sent to work on a case involving the suicidal of a prostitute who's father just so happens to be an old Vietnam war buddy of Murtaugh (Glover) and is involved in a heroin-smuggling operation which leads to some top-notch action. As I said, I am one of a few people who prefer this movie to Die Hard as an action Christmas movie.

Review title: An exciting start for an increadible franchise
Review_body: In this very first chapter, Mel Gibson and Danny Glover already showed an incredible chemistry among them. Adventure, drama and fun i the right mesure.

One of the best movies ever created!
The two leading rolls is a great team.

Review title: Two very different cops team up to investigate the murder of a young woman.
Review_body: Best Quote: I'm too old for this sh*t. - Murtaugh Pros: Gibson and Glover are perfectly cast as the two cops, who initially hate each other but end up forming a strong bond of friendship. The chemistry between the characters is really what carries the movie, and the dialog is very fresh and entertaining. The action is decent and often very imaginative – especially in the scene were Riggs is pretending to buy coke at a Christmas tree vendor. The characters are all really fleshed out and you totally buy them as real people. It is impossible not to like Riggs and Murtaugh.Cons: given that most of the story focuses on the relationship between Riggs and Murtaugh, the rest of the plot ends up feeling a bit secondary, and the villains are only okay.Sentence: Lethal Weapon is easily the best buddy-cop movie of all time, and Gibson and Glover are perfect for each other. It is a movie that you can always watch and that never gets boring. 5/6.

Review title: A really solid enjoyable buddy cop film
Review_body: First time watch of one of the iconic buddy cop films next to rush hour and red heat. Whilst I went in with low expectations and not expecting to enjoy it much yet surprisingly I enjoyed it a-lot more then I expected.The first thing I really liked is the chemistry and dialogue between the two iconic duo. They both really sell their performance and make something really special between their chemistry which made their friendship really believable. Their dialogue is where I got the most laughs seeing them have those conversations had moments which genuinely made me laugh and smirk at some of the jokes in the film. The action itself was definitely well done with some die hard like action that I really enjoyed watching. And some of the side characters I really like and seeing their interactions and dialogue between the two main protagonists was really entertaining. And at times this movie can be pretty serious which for a comedy is kind of rare to find from the opening to Mel Gibsons break down in the caravan is definitely really dark and pretty tense too.However the movie does suffer at times with it's pretty uninteresting villains that the two main characters have to take down. I found those moments pretty uninteresting and just wished the movie would get back to the two main characters quickly. And the final climax did drag on a little too long.Overall this was a fun, entertaining and really enjoyable buddy cop film that has great characters and likeable protagonists in a really good blend of serious and comedic moments. It's not Shane Blacks best work but he still did a good job with the writing in this film.
After Batman. This movie is an amazing movie with great action and the combination of Danny Glover and Mel Gibson is unreal.
